attributes.action: Limit the influence of UNELECTED special advisers like Dominic Cummings
attributes.additional_details:
The government is accountable to the people of this country and transparency is paramount.  Sadly, we currently have a PM who only seems capable of reproducing sound bites - or worse, appears completely absent. The public has the right to know who's 'running the show'.

In this context the disproportionate power and influence of special advisers - especially when they are as controversial as Mr Cummings (remember his questionable role in the 2016 referendum?) needs to be urgently addressed.
attributes.background: In December 2019 29.3% of the electorate voted for the Conservative Party. However, they did NOT specifically vote for any special advisers - like Dominic Cummings and his controversial methods and views.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to change the role of Special Advisers.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, for example a change to the Special Adviser Code of Conduct, which you can read here:

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/832599/201612_Code_of_Conduct_for_Special_Advisers.pdf
